summary: The .NET SDK lacks support for the linux-musl-arm64 runtime identifier, preventing deployment on Alpine-based ARM64 containers. With .NET 10 discontinuing Debian images, Alpine becomes a primary choice, making this support essential for modern containerized deployments.
userImpact: Users cannot deploy the Temporal .NET SDK in Alpine-based ARM64 containers, limiting deployment options as Microsoft transitions away from Debian images in .NET 10.
rootCause: The built-in native shared libraries do not include a compiled binary for the linux-musl-arm64 runtime identifier.
proposedFix: Add support for the linux-musl-arm64 runtime identifier to the built-in native shared libraries alongside currently supported RIDs, with a smoke test at package build time to verify compatibility.
resolutionDetails: Team approved implementation after discussion, recognized as important for supporting modern .NET container practices and Alpine-based ARM64 deployments.
keyQuote: This would enable developers to deploy the .NET SDK on Alpine-based ARM64 containers and maintain compatibility with modern .NET container practices.
